author: Meghan Finnerty , The Republic | azcentral.com
title: 2-year-old drowns in Laveen pool
text:
Get the latest breaking news on azcentral. (Photo: azcentral.com) 
221 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE A 2-year-old drowned in a Laveen pool on Sunday afternoon, despite relatives' and emergency responders' attempts to save the toddler.
It was not clear how long the child had been underwater when family members pulled the toddler out, according to Phoenix Fire Department officials. The 2-year-old's brother began CPR until fire crews could take over, officials said.
The toddler was taken to Phoenix Children's Hospital, where the child was pronounced dead, officials said.
According to a statement from the Maricopa County Sheriff's Office, the 2-year-old was in a backyard pool with about two feet of water. The drowning appeared accidental, the statement said.
Further details were not immediately available.
